intro: Dendrotrophe umbellata, commonly known as the umbrella fern, is a tropical plant characterized by its distinctive fronds that resemble an umbrella. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to regions in Southeast Asia. The plant has a short, stocky rhizome from which the fronds emerge. Its leaves are typically broad and have a leathery texture, with a deep green color. Dendrotrophe umbellata thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often used as an ornamental plant in gardens and indoor spaces.
